metadata.title: CVE-2021-3549 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section toavr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or insome cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability isto integrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3549` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-common - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-for-build - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-for-host - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-source - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.37-7ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.37-7ubuntu1
libbinutils - 2.37-7ubuntu1
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.37-7ubuntu1
libctf0 - 2.37-7ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.37-7ubuntu1').
